extends ClassHierarchy

    • Method Detail

      • getNode

        Node getNode(Class<?> c)
        Look up a class object in this ClassHierarchy. Unlike the version that takes a string in ClassHierarchy, this version does not throw NameResolutionException.

        The behavior of this method is undefined if the provided Class object is not from the ClassLoader (or an ancestor of the ClassLoader) associated with this JavaClassHierarchy. By default, Tang uses the default runtime ClassLoader as its root ClassLoader, so static references (expressions like getNode(Foo.class)) are safe.

        Parameters:
        c - The class to be looked up in the class hierarchy.
        Returns:
        The associated NamedParameterNode or ClassNode.

      • classForName

        Class<?> classForName(String name)
                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException

      • parse

        <T> T parse(NamedParameterNode<T> name,
          String value)
        throws ParseException
        Parse a string value that has been passed into a named parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The named parameter that will receive the value.
        value - A string value to be validated and parsed.
        Returns:
        An instance of T, or a ClassNode.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the value failed to parse, or parsed to the wrong type (such as when it specifies a class that does not implement or extend T).

      • parseDefaultValue

        <T> T parseDefaultValue(NamedParameterNode<T> name)
                    throws ClassHierarchyException
        Obtain a parsed instance of the default value of a named parameter
        Parameters:
        name - The named parameter that should be checked for a default instance.
        Returns:
        The default instance or null, unless T is a set type. If T is a set, then this method returns a (potentially empty) set of default instances.
        Throws:
        ClassHierarchyException - if an instance failed to parse.
